title: 'How's The (Rogan) Josh?' Restaurant Names Dish After Famous Dialogue From Vicky Kaushal's Uri
text:
'How's the Josh?' Well, even after several months of Uri's release, it's still high. The catch-phrase from Vicky Kaushal's film made everyone a fan of the film. 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' which released earlier this year was based on the 2016 surgical strikes and featured Vicky in the lead.

The film was helmed by Aditya Dhar and also starred Paresh Rawal as the National Security Advisor, Ajit Doval, and Yami Gautam as a no-nonsense interrogation officer.

Even PM Modi was seen saying “How’s the Josh?” in his speech. And now, 'How's The Josh' has found another interesting meaning to it.

Actor Vicky Kaushal took to Instagram to share how there's a restaurant that serves a dish named 'How's the Josh'. Sharing picture the menu, Kaushal wrote, “It’s a dish now!” The dish that Vicky wrote about is a mutton dish prepared with spices and saffron and served with jeera naan.

Don't Miss 41.1 K SHARES 10 K SHARES 8.2 K SHARES 6.9 K SHARES 1.8 K SHARES

The film still remains a special one for Vicky's career as he rose to fame and nationwide popularity. It was his first 200-crore film and he also won the prestigious National Award in the Best Actor category, an award he shares with Ayushmann Khurrana (who won it for Andhahun).
description: Even PM Modi was seen saying “How’s the Josh?” in his speech. And now, 'How's The Josh' has found another interesting meaning to it. Actor Vicky Kaushal took to Instagram to share how there's a restaurant that serves a dish named 'How's the Josh'. Read more here.
